The height of the root node is 2, and the number of edges in the longest path from the root node to any leaf node is 7.

The tree has 3 nodes: l, m, and n. The root node l has 2 edges (l->m and m->n). The node m has 3 edges (m->n, n->o, n->q), and the node n has 5 edges (n->r, n->p, n->cb, cb->db, cb->eb). The longest path from the root node l to any leaf node is the path n->p->q->r->l. This path has 7 edges.

Leaf nodes have height 0, so the height of any leaf node is 0.

The input tree is represented as a binary tree where each node represents a letter from the English alphabet. The root node l represents the letter 'l', and its children are m and n. The letters 'm', 'n', 'o', 'q', 'r', 'p', 'x', 'y', 'z', 'ab', 'bc', 'cb', 'hb', 'nb', 'ic' and 'xc' are represented by their respective nodes.

The height of a binary tree is equal to the maximum height of any of its nodes' children. In this case, the height of the root node l is 2, because its children m and n have height 1 each. The height of any leaf node is 0.
